intro: Senecio cenomanensis, commonly known as the Cenomanian senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
